perturbation.original_text: "Change of Control" means, with respect to Company, a transaction or series of related transactions that results in (a) a sale of all or substantially all of the assets of Company, (b) the transfer of fifty percent (50%) or more of the outstanding voting power of Company (other than directly or indirectly to a parent or wholly-owned subsidiary of Company), or (c) the acquisition by a person or entity, by reason of any contractual arrangement or understanding with one or more persons or entities, of the right or power to appoint or cause to be appointed a majority of the directors or officers of Company.
perturbation.changed_text: "Change of Control" means, with respect to Company, a transaction that results in (a) a sale of all or substantially all of the assets of Company.
perturbation.explanation: By removing parts (b) and (c) of the original definition, the scope of what constitutes a 'Change of Control' is severely restricted. Later sections referencing 'Change of Control' will now only apply to the sale of assets, potentially excluding other events that should trigger related clauses, creating uncertainty in enforcement and a contradiction in intent.

perturbation.original_text: "Exclusive Spoken-Word Audio Products" means: (a) spoken-word audio-only products, in a format suitable for digital download and/or streaming, [***]
perturbation.changed_text: "Exclusive Spoken-Word Audio Products" means: (a) spoken-word audio-only products.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the qualifier 'in a format suitable for digital download and/or streaming', the definition of Exclusive Spoken-Word Audio Products becomes ambiguous. This omission creates uncertainty regarding whether physical audio products are also included, which contradicts the agreement's focus on digital content, thus creating an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4.1 Company will comply, and will ensure that the Mirror Company Site, the Spoken-Word Audio Products and all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement (including, without limitation, the participation of ACSI and its Affiliates as contemplated by this Agreement) comply with all applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4.1 Company will comply, and will ensure that the Mirror Company Site comply with all applicable Laws.
perturbation.explanation: By removing  'the Spoken-Word Audio Products and all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement (including, without limitation, the participation of ACSI and its Affiliates as contemplated by this Agreement)' from the original statement, only the mirror company site should comply with applicable laws, rather than spoken-word audio products. This will affect the responsibilities from the company. This creates an internal contradiction with implicit requirements and the new restricted wording, potentially leading to disputes over legal compliance.
